title: Why is the world facing so many natural disturbances | HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: But the kind of breezes that started blowing when Hiranyakasivu and Hiranyakasivu appeared, they were Suddhusvarsaha and they were Pudkaran Iren, Muhuhu.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the unpleasant omens, specifically related to the wind, that manifested at the time of Hiranyakasipu's appearance.

segments.key_quote: As soon as I got out of the car, I immediately got back inside.
segments.summary: The speaker shares his personal experience of arriving in Vrindavan during winter and being shocked by the cold.

segments.key_quote: So, in the afternoon for lunch, Prasadam, we had to go back.
segments.summary: The speaker recounts his experience of the extreme heat in Vrindavan during summer and how the hot breeze felt like fire.

segments.key_quote: So, but then, when Hiranyaksha and Hiranyaka Kshapu were taking birth, the entire climate itself became so bad, that the breeze became, became distrustful, became uninviting to the touch.
segments.summary: The speaker connects the unpleasant weather conditions during the birth of Hiranyaksha and Hiranyakasipu to the current increase in natural disasters like cyclones.

segments.key_quote: The moment we go against the will of Krishna, we go against the laws of nature, we start trying to exploit, material nature as well as other living entities.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that natural disturbances are a result of humanity going against Krishna's will and exploiting material nature, disrupting the balance of the universe.
